column2: VENDORS.TXT: PCI Vendors and Devices
Created automatically from the web using the following URL:
http://www.pcidatabase.com
Original software to create and maintain the PCICODE List written by:
Jim Boemler (jboemler@halcyon.com)
Updated and currently maintained by:
Kavi Corporation (admin@pcidatabase.com)
This header created on Fri Feb 14 09:46:48 PST 2014
This text file is formatted as follows:
Any line starting with a '
A VENDOR line consists of the 4 digit (hex) vendor code, a TAB, then
the vendor name.
A DEVICE line is entered immediately below the corresponding VENDOR ID.
- devices cannot be listed without a corresponding VENDOR line.
A DEVICE line consists of a TAB, the 4 digit (hex) device code,
another TAB, the device number, a space " ", then the device name.
Too many people have contributed to this list to acknowledge them all, but
a few have provided the majority of the input and deserve special mention:
Frederic Potter, who maintains a list for Linux.
Chris Aston at Madge Networks.
Thomas Dippon of Hewlett-Packard GmbH.
Jurgen ("Josh") Thelen
William H. Avery III at Altitech
Sergei Shtylyov of Brain-dead Software in Russia
